block.p: LEAD: Mr. and Mrs. William H. Bevan 2d of Old Greenwich, Conn., have announced the engagement of their daughter Teryn Leigh Bevan to Karl Frederick Weintz, a son of Mr. and Mrs. J. Frederick Weintz Jr. of Riverside, Conn. The wedding is planned for next month.

LEAD: Mr. and Mrs. William H. Bevan 2d of Old Greenwich, Conn., have announced the engagement of their daughter Teryn Leigh Bevan to Karl Frederick Weintz, a son of Mr. and Mrs. J. Frederick Weintz Jr. of Riverside, Conn. The wedding is planned for next month.

Mr. and Mrs. William H. Bevan 2d of Old Greenwich, Conn., have announced the engagement of their daughter Teryn Leigh Bevan to Karl Frederick Weintz, a son of Mr. and Mrs. J. Frederick Weintz Jr. of Riverside, Conn. The wedding is planned for next month.

Miss Bevan, who graduated from Greenwich Academy and Mills College, was until recently a corporate credit analyst at Barclays Bank in New York. She made her debut at the Greenwich Cotillion. Her father is president of the Marine Technologies and Brokerage Corporation in New York.

Mr. Weintz, an alumnus of the Brunswick School, graduated in June from Stanford University with a B.S. in mechanical engineering and a B.A. in anthropology. His father is a limited partner of Goldman, Sachs & Company in New York. The future bridegroom is a great-grandson of the late George B. Cortelyou, who was secretary of the Treasury in President Theodore Roosevelt's Administration.
